text: President Donald Trump has been on a rampage against public schools and colleges all week, threatening to use the power of the federal government to strong-arm officials into reopening classrooms https://t.co/Qm9Ww7rtND

text:

text:

text: A former Breitbart writer and Steve Bannon ally is joining the U.S. Agency for International Development, a few years after her departure from the White House https://t.co/hU3y2Ztug3

name: politico
text: President Trump said he's instructed the Treasury Department to review the tax-exempt status of U.S. schools, colleges and universities, in a pair of tweets that advanced his administration's weeklong drive to turn education into a political wedge issue https://t.co/rOIMelYWKk

name: politico
text:

text: President Trump’s reelection campaign suspended a rally previously scheduled to take place in New Hampshire later this weekend due to concerns over a tropical storm moving up the New England coast https://t.co/JvI4UfWJUl

text: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday reconverted Istanbul's sixth-century iconic Hagia Sophia into a mosque and declared it open to Muslim worship, hours after a high court annulled a 1934 decision that had turned it into a museum https://t.co/BQOpKKpqFf

text:

name: politico
text:
Trump commuted the prison sentence of his longtime adviser Roger Stone.

Stone was sentenced in February to over three years in prison after a jury found him guilty on all seven felony charges brought by Special Counsel Robert Mueller.

https://t.co/IexaASNKHw

name: politico
text: President Trump said Roger Stone was targeted by an "illegal Witch Hunt" in his first public comments since he commuted the prison sentence of his longtime ally https://t.co/L2W75wxtzB

name: politico
text: Late last month, a Democratic data firm found that while new voter registrations had plummeted amid the pandemic, those who were registering in competitive states tended to be whiter, older and less Democratic than before https://t.co/EqQ5DugrlM

name: politico
text: With Michael Flynn on the verge of potentially having criminal charges dismissed altogether, allies of President Trump are pushing to give Flynn the ultimate comeback: hitting the campaign trail for the president https://t.co/NppY6OwiYp

name: politico
text: Trump voiced his support for former national security adviser Michael Flynn, who he has previously hinted at pardoning https://t.co/FH42RldSue

name: politico
text: Trump called for the jailing and extradition of the author of the so-called "Steele Dossier" that salaciously alleged illegal behavior by Trump and his allies before and during the campaign https://t.co/FH42RldSue

name: politico
text:
The president also took aim on Saturday at Jeff Sessions as the former attorney general tries to win back his Senate seat in a primary runoff this Tuesday.

“Jeff Sessions is a disaster who has let us all down. We don’t want him back in Washington!” https://t.co/FH42RldSue

name: politico
